name: disparagingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a critical or unkind way that shows you do not respect someone or something: She denied they had a relationship but she never spoke disparagingly of him. She might get what some disparagingly call "a little part-time job." See
disparaging
More examplesFewer examplesThe prosecutor later wrote disaparagingly of the defence attorney's performance in court.The term "political correctness" has come to be used mockingly or disparagingly.Women often disparagingly refer to their "saddlebags" - fat deposits on the lower hip and upper thigh."How old are you?" he asked disparagingly.
